paper_abstract: Let A(n,d) (respectively A(n,d,w) ) be the maximum possible number of codewords in a binary code (respectively, binary constant-weight w code) of length n and minimum Hamming distance at least d. By adding new linear constraints to Schrijver's semidefinite programming bound, which is obtained from block-diagonalizing the Terwilliger algebra of the Hamming cube, we obtain two new upper bounds on A(n,d) , namely A(18,8) <= 71 and A(19,8) <= 131. Twenty three new upper bounds on A(n,d,w) for n <= 28 are also obtained by a similar way.
paper_title: Improved Semidefinite Programming Bound on Sizes of Codes
